page.title: 16Law and Order
page.content: Lacock's policeman is stationed at Corsham and is also concerned with Gastard and other nearby villages. There are a dozen men and three cars at Corsham police station. Additional man power, cars, dogs, horses etc. are brought in from Chippenham or Bristol as necessary. The{crime rate}in Lacock is not very high and there is rarely a serious offence to investigate. The policeman does a good job in getting to know the people in the area. He spent an afternoon in school talking to the children and showing them all his{safety equipment.} Truncheons, handcuffs and riot protection are otherwise just known to the children through television. Particularly of interest was the tie which clips on to avoid the possible danger of strangling.
